name: Maya Tulum Retreat & Resort

reviews.title: Relaxation, kind people and quiet
reviews.text: My neighbor and I needed to get away from gray Seattle for a week and found the perfect spot in Maya Tulum. We stayed in an oceanfront cabana, complete with outdoor shower. The grounds are lovely, the staff is professional and kind, the yoga was wonderful as were the instructors. I enjoyed my spa treatments and the food, while not out of this world, was good at every meal. We did the mbs package which was a great deal as we could eat from the buffet and/or the menu. While this is a place where yoga happens it did not have an overwhelming yoga vibe- there were all levels in the classes (both my neighbor and I are beginners). My favorite part? not wearing shoes for an entire week!!! I will return next year for my dose of sun, relaxation, kindness and yoga.

reviews.title: This place only gets better!
reviews.text: Minor recommendations- decaf coffee would be a great addition.

reviews.title: Not so great
reviews.text: I want to thank Abraham - who helped me out on a few occasions and always did so with a smile.

reviews.title: Maya Tulum Pros/con - wouldn't go back
reviews.text: I recently returned after a week away in Paradise - again!! I am an unashamed repeat visitor at Maya Tulum - I need my annual fix and this is the best it gets :)

This year I noticed that there were a couple of new Yoga teachers and I tried them both & liked the difference in their styles. I was good to see one familiar face in the Yoga staff as well & the smaller Yoga hall has an incredible new roof and floor now.
reviews.title: An amazing and relaxing week!

reviews.text: Totally burnt-out at work and suffering some MINOR emotional trauma ("recent ex-boyfriend gets 21 yr old college student pregnant", story at 10...), I desperately searched online for the next flight out of town. A cheap $350 ticket landed me in Cancun, with only 4 bathsuits, a sarong and a toothbrush in tow. Having made a quick phonecall to the US-based reservationist (weird) for the Maya Tulum, at least I knew I had a bed that night.
reviews.title: Just OK, should have brought my protein shakes
Best Vacation Ever!
reviews.text: The $90 one-way car ride to the hotel (1-1/2 hr away) was downright extortion - don't pay a peso more. They'll try to get you at the airport for $120.

The resort was actually lovely and it must have been off-season because it wasn't very crowded. The thatched and detached rooms are simple and very charming. I got the Garden Room at the lowest price. Don't opt for the 'partial view' room that looks like a balcony apartment with only a sliver of a view). I didn't have a view, but the beach is literally around the corner, and I'd rather be ON the beach than looking at it through glass. The floors are rugged and toe-stub-threatening, so wear those flipflops! There are little pools of water right outside every door to rinse those sandy feet. Nice.
reviews.title: Bliss

likes.liked: — The sound of the waves lapping outside the windows and the breeze hitting the white curtains

reviews.text: I dropped off my purse and walked neck-high into the soft,warm lapping waves. Maya Tulum has the cleanest, groomed beach for miles. Valium couldn't do a better job.
reviews.title: Night of the Iguanas

likes.liked: — the setting on the carribean coast is stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The treatments were a little hokey - and I seriously loaded up on 6 during my 3 days. They have this PYRAMID chamber that has a zero-gravity support system (i.e. waterbed) in it with surround-sound and subliminal chanting. I had to giggle, but I paid for it, hoping for 'lucid dreams'. Thank goodness it's air-conditioned, because my latent claustrophobia would have kicked in. Not so relaxing. The Yoot-kene was a nice belly rub, and the Maya Clay massage was fun because you get to rinse off in the ocean (imagine the looks as I walked through the resort like a terracota soldier!). My fave was the Shirodara (Ayurvedic version of Chinese water torture)...I think I did have a lucid dream of throwing the ex off a cliff. Awesome.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs, Definitely

likes.disliked: — the way we were treated regarding the bites

reviews.text: I went for the yoga and relaxation through the MBS 7-day program. The yoga was fantastic and I did every single class so I really made progress. The new manager (since 02/06) really hussled to make sure we were taken care of and we were very lucky as the place was not very full. We booked a beach front and I'm glad we spent the additional money since the rooms are larger and you can dress with your windows open since people aren't walking right in front of them. I thought the spa treatments were rather steep for Mexico (although I had 2 50 minute treatments included). An 80 min. deep tissue massage was $100 and I did not even get the full 80 minutes which I felt cheated on. The waiters are leisurely but I made friends with quite a few and if you're in a rush, you just need to remember the menu (it was the same all week for us) and order as soon as you sit down and also request the check. I did not mind the leisurely pace at night, but I wish there was a fast buffet at breakfast and lunch since although the dining room is quite pleasant, I would have rather been sitting on the beach. Actually, on my last day, I just requested lunch to go and lounged on the beach and ate it. If you want to take a walk, definitely walk on the beach since the road has a ton of trash on the side. The suggestions I have for MT is they need an Assistant Manager to handle with interacting with the guests and a buffet for breakfast and lunch (and more non-dairy/fish options for lunch). Also, you have to feel comfortable with the person you're rooming with since the toilet and shower are open to the sink area and over the wall to the bedroom, so you can't be shy with your bodily functions. Also, they didn't seem to be able to give us a separate bill so I ended up paying for quite a few of my roommates' drinks. Anyway, a really great vacation and a beautiful spot. They are stil rebuilding and enhancing after the hurricane last year.
reviews.title: New Management has improved Maya Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at MayaTulum in May of 2006.
reviews.title: Good.... not Great

likes.liked: — The grounds were beautiful as were the accomodations

reviews.title: Easy and relaxed - not trying too hard
reviews.text: We had read so much about this place and knew a few people who had been in the past. All was good, if not great reviews. We are not veg, nor do we really do much yoga, but we thought it would be a nice change of pace.

reviews.title: Wonderful spa and resort
reviews.text: Maya Tulum and the beach is a beautiful place. The rooms are very nice ,clean, slightly rustic, we have been to bali before and have stayed more rustic then this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest Not getting the Mbs package. The food to be honest is not worth the money and there are many places in and around town to eat for less and that are better. Zamas is one. The food is not bad, it's just not good.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon at the Maya Tulum

likes.liked: — beautiful grounds, lovely room, great beach, yoga classes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from eight days at Maya Tulum and found it pretty close to Paradise. I had a beautiful cabana on the beach and I thought the grounds were very nicely groomed. It felt more polished than many of the other hotels (which often resemble something out of Swiss Family Robinson) without being Disney-like. The guests were relatively low-key, although that started to change after Christmas with the arrival of lots of families.
reviews.title: Almost paradise

likes.liked: — great beach, beautiful cabananas, wholesome guests

reviews.text: Lunch and breakfast is definitely good enough, but we went in search of more creative fare for dinner every night. (We didn’t find any of the hotels to be epicurean superstars.) The front staff was helpful, the rooms were kept very clean, and we had great massages. Yoga is available three times a day but pleasantly not the main focus of the hotel. The beaches were raked every morning.
reviews.title: MayaTulum - be warned!

likes.disliked: — the food, the quality of services (massages), location is far, the staff was terrible. too many to list

reviews.text: My only complaint is that something was amiss with their septic system. I’m not sure if this is an ongoing problem or just an isolated incident, but our bathroom always had an unpleasant smell coming out of the drain.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot, warm people, great food

likes.disliked: — for me the surf in our ocean front cabana was too loud at night! but fine with ear plugs

reviews.text: My husband and I love Tulum and when we return again next year, we plan on staying at Maya Tulum again.
reviews.title: Back to Basics - loved it

likes.disliked: — needed to call usa, public phones not working

reviews.text: I was in Maya Tulum the week of Dec 11 and I have to post my experience I had at the "resort" so others know what they are getting themselves into. First off, many of the rooms are not equipped to handle large amounts of rain, so expect flooding in your room from the windows and doors if it rains a lot. The administration seems to have a difficult understanding that "Ocean View" is NOT the same as Ocean SIDE. If you paid for an ocean view, you'll have to complain to get it. We were supposed to have a buffet but instead got stuck with the restaurant style of food, which, although quite good, you will get tired of very quickly. I had better and much cheaper meals in the nearby town. ($4.50 taxi ride).
reviews.title: Beautiful beach and location, but big problems

description: We are located in the magical beaches of Tulum; where in between the white silky sands, and the soothing sound of turquoise waves you will find what you need for your inner journey. In Maya Tulum we offer complete Yoga and Wellness Retreats for your mind, body and spirit to connect and fuse into one, with our yoga classes, spa treatments, wellness therapies, healthy and pescatarian food we create the perfect environment to reach the inner light that lies within each of us, so divine peace can find its way into each of our hearts. We heartly and warmly welcome you to Maya Tulum. In Lak’Ech(I am another You)
